item.description:
Learn from head of operations about how (65) million/annum EPCGenII tags are being used together with cargo seals and GPS to secure the supply chain.

For more detailed event information, please visit http://www.mitforumca....

For registration, please visit https://alum.mit.edu/....

As supply chains extend their reach it has become ever more important to ensure their resiliency. Whether the Red Cross is shipping bloo that must be kept at constant temperature to disaster relief sites or whether tracking basic ingredients and foodstuffs, companies are interested in securing their supply lines. Here to talk about these issues and how some companies are leveraging satellite and/or cellular active RF infrastructure to provide enhanced visibility, are USAID and Conair.

group.name: MITEF of Cambridge RFID Circle (Auto-ID & Sensing Solutions)

item.name: Supply Chain Security Solutions - using 65 million EPCGenII tags/annum
